event.title: In Grantham, Newton lodges with an apothecary [NAR, PON], Mr. Clark, whose brother read chymical books.

data.event: The environment probably intrigued Newton intellectually as well as giving him a years-long experience of family-like life including perhaps an adolescent romance with a girl who was Clark's ward. He built things in the attic. [NAR] Did Newton have access to Clark's shop or regular chores there?" NAR p.55-65. PON

event.title: Before Stanford A, Newton must have read Ripley's Opera omnia chemici (Kassel 1649) [cf. FHP p.160 ¶.1] ...................................................................
Before Stanford A, Newton must have read Tractatus aliquot chemica (Geismar 1647) [cf. FHP p.160 ¶.1] ...................................................................
Before Stanford A, Newton must have read Musaeum Hermeticum (Frankfurt 1625) [cf. FHP p.160 ¶.1] ...................................................................
Before Stanford A, Newton must have read Harmoniae imperscrutabilis . . Decas [I-II] (Frankfurt 1625) [cf. FHP p.160 ¶.1] ...................................................................
Before Stanford A, Newton must have read Basilius Valentinus Currus triumphalis antimonii (Frankfurt 1625) [cf. FHP p.160 ¶.1]** ...................................................................

data.event: This book appears in Stanford "A" even though Newton read it earlier.

event.title: Before Stanford A, Newton must have read Nicholas Flammel, his exposition of the hierographical figures (London 1624) [cf. FHP p.160 ¶.2]** ...................................................................

data.event: Newton kept trying to find a copy of this through the 1690s.

event.title: Before Stanford A, Newton must have read George Starkey Pyrotechny asserted (London 1645) [cf. FHP p.161 ¶.0]** ...................................................................

data.event: Newton still added this title to DCS [desiderata] as late as the 1680s.

event.title: Newton likely wrote the aspirational 5-page Stanford A (MS M132/2/4), 'De Scriptoribus Chemicis' [early 1670s cf. FHP, maybe before Apr 1669 cf. DTW]** ...................................................................
